Name: Part of a wooden coffin
Description: Part of a wooden coffin-lid from a 21st or early 22nd Dynasty type where the background is yellow-brown, and figures painted, in decorative schemes dominated by blue and green. On this segment the tip of a wing from a winged scarab may be seen above a depiction of a protecting cobra. The cobra wears the plumed atef-crown, with wings extended to protect the dead. Beneath it is the hieroglyph for gold, a symbol of eternity.
